text: Growler during RBWG. Pours a hazy yellow with small off white head. The aroma is corn malt and biscuit. Medium body, sweet corn malt, light booze, crushable, thanks Danny!

Sampled during RBWG Tampa 2015. Gold pour with a small head. Fairly oxidized, disappointing aroma. Knackered grain. Sort of papery. Flavor is sort of grainy. A bit of pale malt. Unsavory papery element that I cant get past. Would have loved to have tried this at its peak. Thanks, Dr. Owl.

Growler at RBWG 15 Grand Tasting @ Coppertail, thanks to Dr Owl for this special #, 21/02/15.
Clear light golden with little in the way of a covering.
Nose is pale malt, grain, light citrics, straw, vanilla.
Taste comprises pale malt, grain, lemon, cereals, semi sweet notes.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Ok ML only a tease of a boost though !
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Growler shared during the RBWG 2015 Grand Tasting. What an honour to drink this - thanks, Dr. Owl! Pours hazy yellow with a foamy white head. Dusty pale wood in the nose. Medium sweet flavor with sugary white bread, plain white table sugar. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Sugary finish but reasonably well balanced, with touches of tangerine meringue. Nice one.
Growler. Pours yellow. Nose/taste of corn, light malt and flaked corn chips. Lighter medium body. Clean.
Growler shared at RBWG, thanks Danny. Gold colored. Corn, slight booze heat, a sugary sweetness.

Growler during RBWG 2015 Grand Tasting in Tampa, courtesy of the good doctor himself, thanks Danny! Clear bright golden color, white head. Aroma of corn flakes. Taste has light stone fruit, straw. Bone dry finish.  Tasty.
Draft - Sweet corn and some maple. Clear light yellow. Sweet corn and some light maple notes. Not bad.

Poured a pale yellow color from a growler that was over a year old, aromas of corn, sweetness, booze and light regret. Flavors were corn and booze what I expected with some light bread. Tha KS Danny for the share.

Tasted during RBWG grand tasting. Thanks to drowland for sharing. Clear golden color, some fine particles floating about. Ring of white head. Corn, bread, biscuit. Pretty surprisingly clean, actually. Especially for an older beer. Medium body, lighter than youd expect for an 8% beer. Light slick texture. Very light carbonation. Would definitely be swiggable. Moderate to bigger sweet taste, very light bitter. Touch of apple / pear. Solid stuff, much better than expected.
Growler share from doc owl at rbwg. Sweet corn, clean. Brilliantly clear, pale yellow. Super sweet, lots of corn flavor, clean. More corn.

nice yellow pour with a great white head. Very fluffy. Nice and corny with a bit of sweet malt, some dough, and some signature booze. Very to style for an 8% malt liquor, but a bit cleaner than the macro varieties. Slight bitter finish.
UPDATED: DEC 25, 2013 On draft at Danny Tubas going away party. poured a cloudy cream color with minimal head, slightly fruity with esters and slightly sweet. low level of alcohol warming.

Auld Lang Syne Doc Owl/
Robert Burns would turn this down/
Poets aren't sober.
7/13/13. On tap at Green Room. Thanks, guys! Hazy golden pour with a small khaki head. Light corn, caramel, and pale malts. Really unoffensive. Thanks, Eric and Billy!
